---
title: "Deliverables"
---

### Final Project Report (80% of Grade)
- **Report length:** approx. 5,000 words (excluding references)  
- **Include:** maps, diagrams, and figures  
- **Requirements:** clear structure and planning logic  
- **References:** academic references and policy documents  

### Group Presentation (20% of Grade)
- **Duration:** 15–20-minute presentation per group  
- **Format:** visual presentation (maps, frameworks, strategy)  
- **Focus:** planning rationale and critical reflection  

---

## Evaluation

A **letter grade (A–F)** will be assigned based on the following parts:

- **Final Report:** 80%  
- **Presentation:** 20%  

---

## Assessment Criteria

### Project Report

| **Criterion** | **Focus** | **Weight** |
|----------------|-----------|------------|
| **Problem framing & planning relevance** | Clarity and relevance of the planning problem; linkage to planning objectives, policy goals and societal challenges | 20% |
| **Spatial analysis** | Quality and appropriateness of spatial analysis; use of planning-relevant indicators; critical reflection on data and methods | 20% |
| **Use of Smart City approaches as planning instrument** | Justification and integration of Smart City tools as support for planning and decision-making | 20% |
| **Planning strategy and spatial measures** | Coherence, feasibility, and spatial clarity of proposed planning measures; link between analysis and strategy | 15% |
| **Governance and ethics** | Consideration of governance arrangements, stakeholder roles, ethical issues, and inclusiveness | 10% |
| **Academic quality and communication** | Structure of the report, clarity, use of references, and quality of maps, figures and visual material; command of English | 15% |
| **TOTAL – Project report** |  | **100% (×0.8)** |

---

### Group Presentation

| **Criterion** | **Focus** | **Weight** |
|----------------|-----------|------------|
| **Planning argument and content** | Clarity and coherence of the planning narrative; consistency between problem, analysis, and strategy | 25% |
| **Visualisation and spatial communication** | Quality and effectiveness of maps, diagrams, and visual material in communicating planning ideas | 25% |
| **Delivery, teamwork and discussion** | Structure of presentation, team coordination, time management, and ability to respond to questions | 50% |
| **TOTAL – Presentation** |  | **100% (×0.2)** |
